rComments: Carlos is very dedicated and inspirational! I took his Spanish 6 class as a study abroad requirement and I was expecting a class on improving Spanish speaking, writing, and reading, but instead we learned a lot about Latin-American culture and history. I am very pleased with my advancement in the language through his course on culture.

If you like homework due every day, then this is the class for you! Expect a ton of homework that consists mostly of busy work to show that you read what was expected for you. I NEVER ONCE GOT AN ASSIGNMENT BACK so I had no idea what my grade was going to be, PLUS the final was 14 pages long and took some over three 3hrs to complete.

Carlos is truly one of the best professors I have ever had. To say he is intelligent and knowledgeable is to say the Atlantic ocean is damp. He is engaging and challenging, but simultaneously considerate and understanding. His classes are not easy, but you learn so much. I attribute my ability to speak Spanish to him. Seriously, take his class(es).

Calierno is one of my favorite professors that I've had at UCSC. He's incredibly enthusiastic/knowledgeable about what he teaches and his energy is infectious. He's not the easiest, but don't pass up an opportunity to take his class, you'll get a lot out of it AND have a lot of fun in the process. Highly recommended!

If you want an easy A don't take this class. Calierno kicks your ass but damn do you learn the language. He is funny, helpful, and hands down one of the best professors I've ever had here at UCSC. He really challenges you, but cheers you on the entire time & genuinely cares. Don't slack off. Don't NOT try. If you try you will love this class.
You definitely will improve your Spanish in this class, he's awesome and challenging but in a really good way.
Carlos is an amazing professor, engaging, challenging, and very interested/knowledgeable in what he teaches.
His classes are a lot of work and totally worth it! He's funny, engaging, and really wants you to improve. Extremely helpful especially if you go to his office hours.
His classes are a lot of work and totally worth it. He's funny, engaging, and really wants you to improve. Extremely helpful, especially if you go to his office hours.

Carlos is one of my favorite teachers I've ever had in my college experience. He relates well with students and makes class fun by cracking jokes and being humorous. He is laid back and easy going but when it comes time to get serious and take the test you are prepared. Best Spanish teacher at UCSC!!!!!
this was by the far easiest spanish class i have ever taken.  there was a lot of writing, but it was fairly simple and you get credit for doing it.  i didn't even try that hard and i got a B plus
A lot of work, really funny and sweet. Most of the tests were pretty easy but the final was hard. Doesn't pass back most homework assignments or essays.

Wow. Carlos really knows how to make you work, but you gain alot from it. He structures his classes more like a conversation between students and focuses alot on speaking skills. He calls on individual students, too, which can be nerve-wracking! Only downfall is he doesn't pass back homework, so you never know how you're performing in the class.

I had Carlos for Spanish five, and while at the time I didn't like his class, I learned A LOT. He explains everything in spanish, but when I went to spain for a year I could express complex thoughts all thanks to CARLOS

Carlos is super funny and class is always interesting, but he grades really hard, and it's easy to get lost. His description of grammar and verb tenses are confusing and do not line up with any textbook. You're completely dependent on the exercises completed in class to study for the tests/final, so all you can do is hope you answered them right!

Great professor! Always makes class interesting and fun. Although I feel in the last year he's lost a bit of the enthusiasm he is still a hard worker! He assigns a lot of reading from his reader and has hw assigned everyday. His tests are usually ok but for Spanish 4 the final was crazy long so study hard. Overall understanding & hard-working prof.
Awesome teacher, enthusiastic and cool!

Great teacher!! I wish he taught all spanish levels. Never uses english, even to clarify, so make sure to ask questions. Also go to his office hours if you are not understanding something; he is super helpful and kind hearted. Assigns alot of work but it is usually relevant/interesting and his tests arnt too bad either. Take his class!
Had him for Spanish 2 and 3 and I went from knowing pretty much no spanish, to being fairly confident. He has kind of an individual approach for each student. I recommend him, he is awesome!

Excellent Teacher. Always hilarious and energetic. You learn spanish a lot faster in his classes due to the fact only spanish is spoken, except to define words or clarify concepts. One oral presentation - in his office or in front of the class. Hard Tests, Lots of HW and Participation. I would recommend taking these classes Pass/Fail.
Doesn't get any worse!
Who cares what his political views are- HE IS A BEAST. I second the notion- How can they employ still him??? Stay away!!!! There are someother great spanish teacher but he will make it miserable!

HE IS A GREAT TEACHER, you have to want to learn spanish, teaches class in Spanish. I think some people do not like him in regards to political views, in class you discuss truth about history and events going on today and his views are not conservative

He was an excellent teacher.  Fast paced but he integrated his course with interesting material.  I learned a lot from him.  He is somewhat intimidating and tests were hard but it was the best class I took at UCSC
Horrible. Horrific. How can the still employ him??
I thought he was great.
Intimidating, coarse, and unclear, only a few people could follow him; he failed half the class.  STAY AWAY, and assignes an astonishing amount of work.
No Comments
The WORST teacher I have EVER had at Santa Cruz! No, in my entire academic career. Stay away from him at all costs!!!!!!!!!!!!
Really cool guy. Only speaks in Spanish though.

Carlos is the best!  He's the kind of professor who challenges you while entertaining, and his class is very engaging.  At the end you feel rewarded because of how much your Spanish has improved.  Had him for 4 and 6, 4 is more fun and 6 is totally informative.

This class was not structured around the textbook. The texbook was pretty much just a tool to use if you needed it. Interestingly enough, he taught grammer, politics & culture. He makes it so that students can think in spanish. He's a funny guy. Do the homework & participate. Tests are fair. Took until spanish2h in hs & got an easy A in SPAN2.
I loved this class!! He was so encouraging and I learned so much!

Carlos is a really awesome person. He failed me but I still love him to death. I had health problems throughout and he was always nice. He's the fairest person in the world.. And I don't hold it against him. He is challenging, but that is not a bad thing in UCSC where people are used to just sliding by.

I loved having class with Carlos.  He was one of the first teachers who seemed really enthusiastic, energetic, and involved in communicating his subject matter.  He made the class period fly by.  He expects a lot from his students, but as long as you show interest in learning spanish he'll love you.

If you're really looking to become fluent in Spanish, this prof. puts you to the challenge. He speaks fast, but after about 2 weeks you can really understand him. His materials are fun and engaging, as he is. Class is fast paced-so don't miss it! Tests are hard, best to study in groups. No text book, just a reader. Enjoy it, have fun!

Awesome teacher, very funny and friendly. Assigns a lot of work. Hard but you learn A LOT. Go to office hours because it helps a lot if you don't understand whats going on.  Doesn't use textbooks (which saves me a lot of money). Test are pretty challenging.

Carlos is great! Helpful, funny, lively, very interactive and wants us all to succeed. Attendance is mandatory, and if you miss a class, youll find yourself lost the next day. Workload is consistent and not very demanding. I recommend him.

I liked his class. Be prepared to read the readings that he assigns more than once or twice in order to understand them. You won't know what your grade is until the end of the class because you rarely get your work back, but make sure you do the homework and you'll be fine.
He knows the material and is very relaxed and mellow.  His examples are funny too.
If you have a choice, don't take him.  His class should be called Radical one-sided leftwing politics, en espanol.  If you do take him, you will spend all your time teaching yourself the material.

Carlos is an awesome spanish teacher, very funny and entertaining. He doesn't seem to be anti-america at all, and he does use people's names in his exercises, but not in a mean way. I highly enjoy his class and teaching style.

Carlos Calierno is awesome, but he plays favorites. He makes fun of everyone and uses students in examples on worksheets and tests. It's an entertaining class. Plus you learn and it's reasonably easy. He is very political and anti-america, but he doesn't hate everyone. Whoever wrote that is harsh. Just humor him and agree with his opinions.

Carlos often will refer to his students as "you people." He relentlessly made jabs at the late Chancellor.  He hates America, and you because of where you come from.  His class should be called politics in Spanish.  He grades very unfairly, and wastes too much time with mindless busy work.  I have never failed a calss in my entire life, until his.

Carlos is an ass! He already hates you and where you came from. He speaks so fast it is hard to understand him. Be prepared for unrealated political debates that WILL piss you off. There is a ton of work to do and difficult reading.  Beware this man and take Paco Ramirez. He is the hardest spanish teacher at UCSC. He was the bane of my existence!

Very entertaining, and fun!  I didn't even realize I was learning.  He's also a native speaker which is always a plus.  His sense of humor and emphasis on speaking got even the quietest students talking.  My only criticism is that he wasn't very good about letting students know how they were doing in the class.  I definately reccomend him.

Carlos is a breath of fresh air in an institution based on efficiency and mediocrity. he's a really inspiring teacher and expects a lot because he comes to class everyday extremely energized. you'll learn a lot in his class, but don't expect too much clarification in class, office hours are necessary.
Carlos was a great professor.  even though his class is really work intensive, you'll learn alot.  he'll pull out the revolutionary in you.  really nice too.
Calierno's class was very engaging.  I don't know how he kept up the energy he came in with everyday!!   This was a great class, definitely recommend it, but don't expect to be able to slack off.
exellent, nothing but exellent....a college class that had standards and ideas that didnt run out

Carlos is a great person, but made assumptions about my ability to speak Spanish because I am Mexican, he kept telling me I must have grown up a Native Speaker, he even asked my host mom (as if I was lying to him). Consequently, he was grading me really hard and didn't give me due credit or help when i needed it. he also wrote me an eval with someone elses name on it. A work, I got b's except for the "culture" part (b/c I'm Mexican?).

Carlos is Amazing...con un capital "A" . His class was both engaging and interesting. He is by far one of the most dynamic teacher(person) I have ever met. His class is challenging, and should be. College is for being pushed, not having it easy. I highly reccommend him and shame to those to didnt want to put in enough effort to pass.

Carlos is an amazing professor. He's one of those that is very difficult academically, but is an excellent teacher. Don't take his class if you're looking for an easy A - take it because you want to learn more about the language, cultures and politics. He's great if you're really into radical politics.

Carlos is quite possibly the best Spanish teacher I have ever had.  He speaks clearly and makes it easy to communicate with him, and he genuinely cares about his students.  His tests are challenging, but as long as you take notes in class and study, you will be fine.  He assigns hard readings, but does not expect perfect comprehension.
He was awesome!  I love him because he lead good discussions and it we did fun writing projects.

Carlos IS notorious for failing people, but I turned in my hmwk late a lot, and on my 15 pg final paper/movie analysis, I had no quotes and did it the night before the final.  i did ok on the final (i was tired) BUT i got a 'B' in the course.  I DID work hard but there was TONS of work.  good class!

He was very unfair to people that tried hard and just needed a little help.  If you don't know spanish well and want to learn more about the grammar aspects don't take this class.  He dwells on his political views and not the actual spanish class.   He loves to fail people!!!

WOW!! Was that a difficut class. I usually get A's in spanish, was even raised with spanish in the household, and I struggled! He expects you to work hard. Interesting personality, with humorous lectures. Definitly don't take this class if spanish isn't up to par.

Carlos Calierno's class will change your life.  His course is overwhelmingly difficult, and he is an exceedingly intelligent and sensitive person.  However, there is a catch; his grading system is unjust.  He fails a large number of hard working, A caliber students.  A special class but BEWARE.

His tests were way too long to do in the time given and he gave too much hw. His class was fun to be in, but the homework/essays/tests were very difficult even for students who usually get A's in Spanish. I thought I was failing, but ended up getting an A with more effort than I expected to put in.

Always late to class, horrible about returning test and essays in a timely manner. I didn't get back 2 of my three essays and he never mentioned how he graded presenations. The whole class was very rushed so it felt like there wasn't enough time to learn everything efficiently.

Carlos was the best language teacher I've ever had.  He has a conversation-oriented teaching style; he usually preferred talking with students about history, culture, or current events rather than lecturing from the chalkboard.  His classes aren't actually *that* hard; as long as you do the work!

dude, he's a good teacher if you speak fluent spanish but other than that he's hard! He'll bust ur ass and push come to shrove he won't pass U. You should take this class if your spanish is good, if not don't take it.

I think he wishes he taught another subject (politics?).  He will skim over important grammar lessons to talk about his pet political views.  So much propaganda, I found myself wanting to take the other side just for a little balance

Great prof, he's very interesting and pushes students. I learned SO much in his class, my speaking improved tenfold. Very interesting guy, but the class is VERYVERY hard. He gives a lot of work and is a VERYYYY harsh grader. Be prepared to WORK.
I think Calierno is a great teacher. He makes you work very hard, but I have learned a lot.
hard class be prepared to work yer butt off, read a lot, and then be held accountable for *gasp* having a functioning brain. spanish with carlos isn't your typical easy language course.

Carlos is the most wonderful professor I have had at UCSC. He is not easy by any means, but his classes and the material he teaches are fascinating. He expects a lot from his students, but he makes himself very available for help. Very jovial and fun!

The most rediculious teacher I've ever had. People who have always gotten A's past spanish classes fail his class!! He's rediculiously hard. And make sure you're on his good size or else you're doomed to fail the class! Whatever you do avoid taking him!
